intro: Unona clavata, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright, branching stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Unona clavata is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
